oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Influence of fertilisation on furanocoumarins content in two celeriac varieties
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Schulzova, Vera
Botek, P.
Hajslova, Jana
Babička, L.
Kouřimská, L.
Václavíková, K.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Food security, food quality and human health
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The aim of this study was to investigate the effect of the way of celeriac cultivation on the content of naturally occurring toxicants - furanocoumarins. Their levels have been shown to be strongly affected by an individual variety and also fertilization method. Organic farming using anaerobically fermented pig slurry was compared with mineral, combined, and non-fertilized farming. The climatic conditions in particular crop years play an important role in the furanocoumarins occurrence.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Schulzova, Vera; Botek, P.; Hajslova, Jana; Babička, L.; Kouřimská, L. and Václavíková, K. (2008) Influence of fertilisation on furanocoumarins content in two celeriac varieties. Poster at: Cultivating the Future Based on Science: 2nd Conference of the International Society of Organic Agriculture Research ISOFAR, Modena, Italy, June 18-20, 2008.
